column2: KS DMV PERMIT TEST
Question Text
1. When entering an interstate highway, drivers should:
column4: adjust speed to meet a traffic gap, then merge at a safe speed.
column6: wait for an opening in traffic on the entrance ramp.
column8: check for cars and slow down to 25 MPH before merging with the flow of traffic.

column2: 2. The road is the most slippery:
column6: when it first starts to rain.

column2: 3. In case of skidding, drivers should NOT:
column4: tap the gas pedal with their foot.
column6: pump the brakes gently if they are about to hit something.
column8: take their foot off the gas pedal.

column2: 4. If traffic on the other side of an intersection is backed up and you cannot get completely through, you must:
column4: enter the intersection and proceed with caution.
column6: wait until traffic ahead is clear.
column8: enter the intersection and try to avoid blocking it.

6. To avoid hydroplaning you should:
column6: slow down when roads are wet.

column2: 7. When preparing to exit an expressway, drivers should start reducing their speed:
column4: about halfway through the deceleration lane.
column6: at least 100 feet before entering the deceleration lane.
column8: immediately upon entering the deceleration lane.

column2: 8. What should drivers do when they see this sign?
column4: Look to the left and right for other traffic.
column6: Make sure the bridge is clear of oncoming traffic before they cross.

column2: 9. After parking, are you allowed to open a door on the road side of your vehicle?
column6: Yes, but only if it does not interfere with bicyclists and other traffic.

column2: 10. Arrows on the roadway:
column4: show which lanes you must use.

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column6: Do not use your brakes in this area

column2: 12. The sign in the picture:

column6: is a Construction and Maintenance Traffic Control sign.
column8: is found at most intersections and indicates that drivers must yield to other vehicles.

column2: 13. ___________ normally are white rectangles with black letters or symbols.
14. To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should:
column4: tailgate the driver in front of you.
column6: drive above the posted speed limit.

column2: 15. Alcohol:
column4: makes you less aware of what is happening to your driving abilities.
column8: makes it easier to make correct decisions.

column2: 16. What should you do in case of a steering failure?
column4: Don't panic. Turn on your emergency lightsÂ to let other drivers know you are having car problems. Move toward the side of the road and bring the car to a gradual stop.
column8: Pump your gas pedal a few times to increase the pressure.

20. Which of the following substances can affect the ability to drive?
column4: Cold tablets containing codeine or antihistamines.

column2: 21. This road sign means:
column4: Lane reduction - the right lane ends soon
column8: Lane reduction - the left lane ends soon

column2: 22. Destination signs are ______ with ____ letters and symbols.

24. Drivers may cross a double yellow line to pass another vehicle if:
column4: the yellow line next to the other side of the road is broken.
